thread.title: Big Pink building's sale price was a record-breaker
thread.title_full: Big Pink building's sale price was a record-breaker | OregonLive.com

author: Luke Hammill | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Big Pink building's sale price was a record-breaker
text:
The sale of Portland's U.S. Bancorp Tower, reported in August , turned out to be a record-breaker.
Nicknamed "Big Pink," the city's second-tallest skyscraper sold for $372.5 million, according to a quarterly report from the commercial real estate firm Jones Lang LaSalle. The firm found that the transaction represented "the largest single asset office sale in the history of the Portland market."
TPF Equity REIT – a real estate investment trust associated with UBS Global Real Estate, a Connecticut-based institutional real estate manager – paid $338 per square foot for the 42-story tower. The seller was LaSalle Income & Growth Fund V.
Seattle-based Unico Properties, the co-owner and manager of Big Pink, retained a minority stake and continued to manage the building.
Earlier this year, the Overton Pearl office building in Northwest Portland sold for $500 a square foot , for a total price of nearly $31 million.
The deals happened during a year that saw low vacancy rates and climbing rents for office space in Portland's commercial real estate market.
-- Luke Hammill
